⸻

This is your chance to be the reason a cybersecurity startup gets seen by the world — and builds something worth acquiring.

title: Rockstar Social Media Manager
description:
FULL-TIME SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER (SHORT-FORM CONTENT STRATEGIST & EXECUTOR)
Son of Wisdom Men’s Movement | Founded by Blake Templeton
Influencer Brand | High-Ticket Coaching | Biblical Masculinity | Global Men’s Transformation Movement

Role Overview
This is a ground-floor opportunity to help lead the charge in a global movement that is resurrecting men into the leaders, husbands, and fathers they were called to be.
Son of Wisdom is not just a brand—it’s a brotherhood. A mission. A message rooted in ancient wisdom, designed to heal modern men and restore them to their true design. We are transforming marriages, rebuilding families, and awakening men to live as Kings—not by the world’s standards, but by biblical design.
This role will be the architect and executor of a high-volume, high-impact short-form content engine. You will take the deep revelations and soul-awakening truths within our brand vault and translate them into bite-sized content that speaks directly to the soul of a man.
We will be producing over 1,000 pieces of content per H^month^H at full capacity. This includes 150+ short-form videos to each be posted for Reels, TikTok, Shorts, and more—plus tweets, carousels, image quotes, and static posts designed to build an ecosystem of transformation across all major platforms.

Core Responsibilities
1. Short-Form Video Execution & Optimization
Extract powerful moments from Blake’s video teachings, livestreams, podcasts, and voice notes—and convert them into short-form videos for Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and Facebook.

-Craft and fine-tune hooks, titles, thumbnails, captions, and CTAs that not only capture attention but call men into purpose.
-Optimize videos for each platform based on formatting, algorithm behavior, and cultural nuance.
-Partner with our video editors to finalize post-ready content with visuals that are clean, aligned, and on-brand.
-Manage the scheduling and publishing of 150+ short-form videos monthly, each on 5 different platforms, ensuring consistency and strategic alignment.


2. Static Content Creation & Brand Messaging
-Own the creation of our tweets, Instagram carousels, static image quotes, and text posts using our core content library and weekly voice note drops from Blake.
-Maintain brand consistency across all assets—every word, image, and caption must sound like it came from a place of biblical truth and masculine authority.
-Align each piece of content with a strategic purpose: generate awareness, build our email list, drive men to apply for 1-on-1 consults, grow our Skool community, or deepen audience trust.


3. Strategic Intelligence & Platform Analysis
-Conduct weekly competitive research to monitor the content strategies of other top men’s brands, influencers, and coaches.
-Reverse engineer the most successful short-form content from peers and industry leaders—identify what’s working, why it’s working, and how we can improve it.
-Analyze funnels, content flows, platform strategies, and email nurturing systems from competitors to sharpen our overall content ecosystem.


4. Campaign Planning & Execution
-Collaborate with Blake and our CMO to build content calendars and strategic initiatives around launches, promotions, and program milestones.
-Infuse each post with purpose. Whether it’s pointing to a lead magnet, warming the audience for a program, or creating a viral moment—it all ties into the larger vision.
-Play a key role in connecting content output with our marketing funnel, ensuring that every content piece serves a broader goal of impact and conversion.


5. Analytics, Reporting & Continuous Optimization
-Monitor and report on key metrics: reach, engagement, watch time, conversion, click-through rates, and DM responses.
-Run tests on different hooks, formats, thumbnails, and post styles to uncover the best-performing frameworks.
-Adapt quickly to platform changes and audience behavior shifts to keep the content strategy agile and impactful.


Who You Are
-You are highly skilled in social-first content creation, short-form editing, and platform-native storytelling.
-You are purpose-driven—you don’t just want a job, you want to be a part of a cause that transforms lives.
-You have a strong eye for copywriting, branding, and emotional intelligence—you understand what moves a man to stop, listen, and act.
-You are organized, agile, and proactive—you thrive in a fast-paced, high-output environment.
-You resonate deeply with our mission to restore biblical masculinity and call men into leadership, strength, and family redemption.



Required Skills & Experience
-3+ years of experience managing social media and producing short-form content across platforms like TikTok, Instagram, YouTube Shorts, and Facebook.
-Proven success in growing online platforms and personal brands through short-form content.
-Expert-level copywriting for hooks, captions, and tweets that drive attention and conversions.
-Strong graphic design ability (Canva or similar tools) to create polished, branded static posts.
-Proficient in using AI tools for workflow acceleration and content repurposing.
-Experience with competitive research, funnel hacking, and applying insights to boost content ROI.

Success Metrics
-Publishing 150+ short-form videos/H^month^H across all core platforms
-Growth in followers, reach, engagement, shares, and DMs
-Positive trend in email list subscribers and inbound 1-on-1 consult applications
-Increased views and performance of static posts, tweets, and carousels
-Strategic campaigns executed on-time and in sync with business goals

This would be a full-time Social Media Manager role to lock arms with our core team and move in sync with our rhythm. 

***3 Non-Negotiables to note***

#1 This is an exclusive role. That means no freelance work or side gigs—we’re looking for someone all-in.

#2 We only hire long-term. If you’re looking for a quick 12-H^month^H gig, this won’t be the right fit. We’re building legacy, not launching a temp project.

#3 For us to collaborate in real-time, it’s important that you align with our work schedule—
9am-6pm CST. 

We’re in the trenches daily, pushing hard and moving fast, and we need someone who is present, responsive, and fully immersed in the mission. I also own an investment firm and my time is limited, so when I need to speak to a team member, video calls right then are paramount for speed and to remove bottlenecks.

To align for expectations: 
This is a 160-hour per H^month^H role (full-time), and we’re offering $6-7/hr as a starting rate, with strong performance-based bonus incentives. For example, within 12 months, it would be possible to earn an additional $6/hr on top of base pay, based on performance, contribution, and alignment with our vision.

But more than the money, we’re offering something most companies can’t:
A seat at the ground floor of a world-changing movement. A culture where your work directly contributes to transforming broken families, healing marriages, and restoring men to their God-given identity.
If you’re excited by the idea of being a vital part of a team that is storming the gates of hell and setting men free worldwide—while mastering your craft and growing in responsibility—then this may be your calling.
Let me know if this resonates with you. We’d love to explore if this is a divine fit.


What You’re Stepping Into
You’re not joining a company—you’re joining a movement.
A movement that is raising men back to their God-ordained identity. A mission that doesn’t just change timelines—it changes legacies. This is your opportunity to help lead that charge through the most powerful medium of this age: short-form content with eternal purpose.
If you want to be part of a high-performance team on the frontlines of global men’s transformation, this is the place.

title: Interior design for a 19th century London aristocratic opium den
description:
I am looking for an interior designer to work with in an iterative manner, part time over the course of 2-3 months to create a conceptual design and then a detailed 3D SketchUp interior of a 12’ by 20’ room decorated to look like a 19th century London opium den for aristocrats. It isn’t clear such places really existed, but there is enough art to recreate their style :)

I have created a design document with a description of the room including photographs I like of each feature of the room. First I want conceptual sketches in Photoshop or Illustrator (or another) format that express your interior design ideas. Once we refine and arrive at a look and feel, I want a precise 3D SketchUp model and renderings of the final design that I can give to a decorator to recreate the design in my next home.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1P-Hntiea2NJZDO1F1ADP7dQE19Pb4cuHk9wr-fMPtkw/edit?usp=sharing

Design influences are from Orientalist painting of the near east in the 18th and 19th centuries, the Ottoman Empire, China, Turkey, Morocco, Egypt and the Levant. Everything in the room is to be deep red / maroon, except perhaps for a few yellow, gold or silver accents. I’m open to ideas for other colors to include but overall it should be dark and maroon.

I want a low maroonOttoman couch along two walls, big maroon pillows, maroon tufted pleather walls, a Moroccan lamp that casts patterns of light hanging from an oval, deep blue recess in the ceiling simulating with LEDs a starry sky at dusk, a recessed flatscreen TV in a wall opposite the couch, 2-3 dark, hardwood wooden bookshelves, a red or maroon hookah, a table equipped with an opium tray with Chinese pipe, lamp and tools. I have photographs I like of all of these things to guide you in my vision for the room.

While I have a vision for the room, you will have creative freedom within the specifications. Impress me with your ideas… we can try more than one concept and iterate! I am not a designer but I did took a series of design classes in school that mean I recognize and appreciate good design. I have experience with a dozen projects collaborating with a design team to create logos, marketing materials, user interfaces and websites. I know how to work with a designer to define a vision and let the designer use their creative capacity to make something amazing. This is a conceptual rather than spec design project that I want you to have fun with!

title: Freelance Senior Backend Developer
description:
We’re Jubilee Media.

At Jubilee, we're on a mission to provoke understanding and create human connection. We explore experiences that push people to feel more, think more, and see more in others. We challenge the belief of a black-and-white world, and instead embrace the complexity and richness of our experiences. By magnifying these stories we can discover personal identities, shared truths, and how we fit in the overarching human story. You'll lead our tech and product teams to develop APIs, design architecture that supports millions of users, and make sure the nectar app runs smoothly.

- Collaborate cross-functionally with product, growth, and frontend teams to ship high-impact features quickly

Who You Are:

- Expert in Node.js, TypeScript, GraphQL, and Postgres/SQL
- Experience in AWS and/or other cloud providers
- Passion for using the latest AI coding tools and AI-driven best practices to enhance development workflows

title: Structural Engineer Needed for Hillside Deck Design (WA Code Compliance – Klickitat County)
description: I'm planning to build a freestanding 24×24 ft wood frame deck on a hillside in Klickitat County, Washington. I need engineering support to finalize the structural design in accordance with Washington State building codes, including a ground snow load of 75 psf. I'm looking for a licensed structural engineer with experience in wood construction and engineered lumber. The scope includes advising on material selection and sizing (posts, beams, joists), and providing stamped calculations and drawings for county permit submission.

title: Full-Stack App Ghostbuilding Specialist
description:

Any questions you have about the project or our lab

Let’s ghost the future.
— Team Polymaths A

description:

title: Social Media Manage
description:
Job Title:
Social Media Manager for U.S.-Based Trucking & Logistics Company

Job Description:
We are a U.S.-based trucking and logistics company seeking an experienced Social Media Manager to manage and grow our presence on Instagram, Facebook, and other relevant platforms.

Key Responsibilities:
	•	Create and publish high-quality, engaging content tailored to the U.S. trucking and logistics audience
	•	Develop content calendars and posting schedules
	•	Design posts (images, reels, short videos) based on provided ideas, promotions, and industry trends
	•	Ensure brand consistency across all platforms
	•	Monitor engagement, respond to comments/messages professionally and timely
	•	Collaborate with our internal team to implement strategic campaigns
	•	Report on performance analytics and suggest improvements

Language Requirements:
	•	English – fluent
	•	Russian – fluent
	•	Ukrainian – preferred

Requirements:
	•	Proven experience managing social media for U.S.-based businesses (preferably in logistics, transportation, or similar industries)
	•	Strong English writing and communication skills
	•	Graphic design and video editing skills (Canva, CapCut, or similar tools)
	•	Understanding of current social media trends in the U.S. market
	•	Ability to follow instructions and adapt content to our brand voice and values
	•	Experience with Instagram Reels, Facebook Stories, and scheduling tools like Buffer or Hootsuite is a plus

Preferred Qualifications:
	•	Knowledge of the U.S. freight/trucking industry
	•	Familiarity with paid social ad campaigns (optional)

Please include examples of social media accounts you’ve managed, along with samples of your visual or written content.

title: White-Label CRM + Email Marketing Automation Expert
description:
Overview:
I’m seeking a skilled CRM and email marketing expert to serve as a white-label implementation partner for Iris Flower Co., a business development platform helping real estate agents build fundable, protected, and scalable businesses.

This will be an H^ongoing^H partnership to support our real estate agent clients who purchase bundles, courses, or consulting. All work must be delivered under Iris Flower Co. branding with a clean, professional handoff experience.

⸻

 We Need Help With:
	•	Setting up CRMs for solo agents and small teams (Flodesk, GoHighLevel, ConvertKit, or similar)
	•	Customizing CRM pipelines, tags, and client segmentation
	•	Designing branded email templates (welcome series, follow-ups, newsletters)
	•	Building automated drip campaigns (5–10 email sequences)
	•	Integrating with forms, calendars, and lead capture tools
	•	Reporting and analytics setup

⸻

 Ideal Experience:
	•	Previous CRM/email automation experience for real estate agents or consultants
	•	Portfolio of visually branded emails and flows
	•	Understanding of how real estate professionals nurture leads and clients

⸻

 You’ll Be Provided:

⸻

Scope:

This is a project-based contractor role with the potential to evolve into a monthly retainer or preferred vendor status for our community.

Please include:
	•	CRM platforms you specialize in
	•	Examples of email templates or campaigns you’ve built
	•	Your standard rates for setup + automation buildout
